learning_objective: Modify, remix, or incorporate portions of an existing program into one's own work, to develop something new or add more advanced features.
topic: Addition, subtraction, multiplication, division with whole numbers
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is working on a Quorum Math Library that includes the four basic arithmetic operations - addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. They decide to extend an existing function for addition to include subtraction. The initial function simply adds two parameters, a and b, and returns the result. To incorporate subtraction, Alex must modify the function to check an operator parameter that could be either '+' or '-', and then perform the corresponding operation. Below is the modified function. What result will be generated from the call arithmetic('3', '-', '1')?",
    "Answer1": "2",
    "Answer2": "-2",
    "Answer3": "4",
    "Answer4": "'3-1'",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "The operation arithmetic('3', '-', '1') determines if the operator is '+' or '-'. Since the operator is '-', it performs subtraction: 3 - 1, which equals 2.",
    "code_snippet": "action arithmetic(integer a, text operator, integer b) returns integer\n    if operator == '+'\n        return a + b\n    else if operator == '-'\n        return a - b\n    end\nend"
}
